intro: Lathyrus sylvestris proles pyrenaicus, commonly known as the Pyrenean wild pea, is a perennial climbing plant native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in rocky and woodland habitats, often found in alpine and subalpine zones. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
